Wooowoooo!

m6RU5Ov4C1uMQRr3J0Fvfg.review_text: If you get sea sick, do NOT go here! I cannot emphasize this enough. Strangely, I never get sea sick but this experience was such a doozy that it left half my party feeling queasy, myself included.   Other things to know: you have to take a WATER TAXI there. We didn't know this and was told when we got there (by a random guy on the street helping us poor clueless souls) to walk down the ramp and use the phone to call the restaurant. Well, we didn't have to do that because there was such a line, which caused the water taxi to take one group while we waited on the swaying dock. Did I mention we were 30 minutes late for our reservation?  That being said, the idea behind the restaurant is very cool. The food was excellent (holler to the steak) but I would never want to go back again. Yay for the experience, nay for a return trip.

gFn0pKyMCB1Z3fBGghoppw.review_text: It was Dine About Town time and we sat down to look through the list of places to try.  I wanted to go to all the overrated places to see if they lived up to the hype, HE wanted Forbes Island.  Forbes Island?  Isn't that the weird thing down by that unmentionable place I never go to?  (Ahem.  Fisherman's Wharf)  I can't believe we're going THERE.  I was very skeptical, thinking this place was a giant gimmicky tourist trap... but I was completely won over by this place.  It's cute and quirky.  How often do you eat underwater a la 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea?  Or use a bathroom in the captains quarters?  Or walk the sand beach on the island with the bartender who shows you the WWII engine?  Or climb a lighthouse on the world's only man made floating island?  The food was surprisingly good.  The pan seared flat iron steak was cooked well with an interesting mustard sauce and the chicken had a delicious wine creme fraiche sauce that wasn't overpowering.  Dessert was amazing.  The chocolate mousse was so good my normally dessert-disliking BF declared it as the best dessert he's EVER had.  Kudos to whomever won him over with that.  The whole experience from ambiance to food was enjoyable.  This place won me over completely.  I left with a happy stomach, pictures of a houseboat on steroids and a big smile on my face.

zopHNC4dgSRgNabIKeZSJQ.review_text: A sunset ferry ride. A walking tour of a lighthouse. All included with the price of your dinner. A pretty good deal for a pretty meal.  This was a double date dinner to Forbes Island. Each couple had a coupon for free entree with the purchase of roasted chicken breast, pan-roasted salmon or flat iron steak entree.   While waiting for our other party to arrive, there is plenty to explore on the island including a sea lion serenade and a self-guided tour of a 56-stair lighthouse. The dining room itself made me feel like I was on a pirate ship with the sword and chain decorations. Lighting is dim with a romantic setting with sunlight shining through the stained window panes and reflecting off the mirrored walls. Try to get a seat next to the window to see the fish since the restaurant is underwater.   The meal started off with soft sourdough bread and salt and pepper butter. We order a bottle of Jade Mountain 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon. It was a smooth wine that paired well with our steaks.  My medium-rare steak was drizzled with a peppercorn glaze. The potato-au-gratin (my favorite style to serve potatos) had a very buttery bechamel sauce and was served with a side of crunchy string beans and a carrot.  Before you leave, ladies should make sure they make the detour to the captain's room to wash your hands. The layout is quite charming.   Be warned,  the floating island does get shaky and after a hour on the island, the tiny tremors of the island shifting with the waves does get nauseating. But feel free to walk around upstairs. They also validate parking. The experience is unique and worth it at least once for locals and tourists alike.  ~Cheers.

1qdrLTiKcadTAg9NImDBJg.review_text: Everyone should experience Forbes Island at least once in their life.   It was pretty cool having the owner of the place drive you in his little boat thing to and from his resturant.   I thought "Dining under water? That sounds like so much fun!" Well....you can't see out of the little windows very well. And what's on the other side of those windows? Greenish murky bay water. However, there's no doubt you are under water. The rocking....it made me a bit sea sick. It could be I was just super hungry and the food was taking a while, or it could be a combination. Sounds like an unpleasent experience, but once the food got there, it was alllll good.   I had the Pan Seared Flat Iron Steak with the Potatoes au Gratin. So very delicious. After, we climbed the light house to get a view from the top. It was pretty cool.

0oz9oETsRdv-IzHQpwbWlQ.review_text: I had the filet mignon and it was amazing. The broccoli mushroom puff was delicious. Food and service were great! Super fun experience. There is a little bit of rocking on the boat, so if you get sea sick, that may be a slight issue. Other than that, this place is a hit!

lY9_1P-NAQTCocQqt337YQ.review_text: It's pretty exciting to be on the island and see the city from a different angle. My overall experience was fun. The island was pretty cool and the restaurant is very romantic, albeit rocky. Everything on the menu was mediocre, I was not impressed with the food, at all. Go once and check it out for yourself. Now that I've been, I don't think I'll ever go back.

nynL-ys6Wc2mJHQ6j0uz9Q.review_text: Forbes Island has become one of our favorite places for dinner in the area. It combines the fun of wandering through Pier 39 with the enjoyment of a wonderful dinner. The food is excellent...perfectly seasoned and prepared. I was thrilled to find that lamb was a special of the night recently and enjoyed it thoroughly. My husband had the fillet and was pleased as always.   The ambiance adds to the enjoyment as does the service. Casey has been our server a number of times and has always provided excellent advise and care.   It is a unique experience and a wonderful meal.

S3gNrUh7N9oWoackKlHGMQ.review_text: Sure, the novelty of the island is cool, and Captain Forbes seems a bit kooky (Was this really his home in Sausalito or is he creating some sort of restaurant mythology?), but the food was just average for the prices we paid.  I had the filet mignon, which was pretty bland, so they covered it in rich sauce.  The chocolate cake was pretty good, but I preferred the whipped cream that topped it.  I guess it was neat to run up the lighthouse and to try to peer through the underwater portholes, but I sort of hated it when we wanted to leave, but the little shuttle boat was not docked to take us back to shore!

vZqPSRJ4rW-15vqSJFvuWQ.review_text: We dropped in on Forbes and his island because we wanted to do something in SF we'd never done before.  We expected tourist kitsch and what we found was a locals paradise.  Well shame on us for not getting there sooner.  This place is a treasure!!!  Forbes himself is a bit of mystery, but I like him that way.  We'll be back to decode him and this place a bit more.   The meal was fantastic, the service was top notch.

0MgM3bLJ8uk3UulwDZ2NPw.review_text: I arranged our company holiday party at Forbes Island. Mine is a tough crowd of designers with many varied opinions on what/where, etc. This was absolutely - hands down - a great success. Every single person who attended (and we had incredible attendance because of the site - about 100 people) had fun and thanked me for choosing this site. Casey (event manager) was brilliant, the food was great and our event went off without a hitch. I highly recommend Forbes Island! Oh - and the VIEWS are spectacular!

yZbDsPetl-ePLTxywjU58A.review_text: something unique to experience to go for a boat ride and be on a restaurant island but food is not great! It would be nice if there is a view when sitting in the dining room

VSRtEK_c84oJygZ0OX0Oqg.review_text: This place is really fun! You take a little boat (driven by the owner of the restaurant) from Pier 39 to the island. The food is good, and it's cool eating on a mini island. The dining room we were in was downstairs, and you can see fish swim by the windows. After dinner, you can go up to the top of the lighthouse on the island (if it's not too cold and windy).

VG6CF2SD7lKngykpwBx76w.review_text: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  The food has always been amazing, perfect on a summer evening.  Be sure to get a reservation.

dAGEp2Hm2Tp84u9zLqlhXQ.review_text: Amazing food!! Server - Casey was very welcoming and made us feel at home! Can't wait to go back! They view was awesome all over and from the lighthouse :) Must go here!!!!

VarPmrQsBeeLZ9suKpxYug.review_text: I have been making a list of places I have yet to write a review for and this one was creeping up. Why not? This place is intriguing. It captures you and makes you want to go there. The place in itself piques your interest. It has you thinking, "WTF is it? It can't be a real island. Wait it's near where all those noisy, stinky seals are?"   Well whatever gets you to go here you will either love it or hate it. I happened to love it. My wife and I came here for dinner on a Stormy night. Ok, maybe not stormy to most but I grew up in the bay and a little rain is stormy to me. You take a little shuttle boat to the island and that's pretty cool. Once you get on the island you realize what has been done here. It's really a ship. It's a ship with its own self-contained Eco system with a light house on top and an actual island feel.  Then you go into the restaurant itself, which is the hull. Yes, it sways back and forth and probably did so on this night more so than the norm. But you would be an idiot to think this wouldn't happen. The people that knocked stars down because of this just didn't deserve to come here. Just order some whiskey sours and after a few sips you wouldn't be able to tell the place was moving anyway.  The wait staff, and service all around was amazing. The food was great. I went filet mignon and that was delectable. Price can be steep but hey, it's not an everyday thing. Do it for the wife you love, the girlfriend you want to wife up but not the girl you see after hours with low self esteem. There are other establishments for those types. Most of the time Popeyes will do for those occasions.   If you are a person who gets sea sick you should be prepared because you are dining underwater. For a nice dinner for two, expect $200 and a tip. Don't be that person who doesn't tip. These waiters are pretty amazing and so is the kitchen staff and chef for dealing out the amazing food they serve here. Oh yeah, once inside you forget about the seals. So just get over it.

1HK5xZxoWVvh7d-OVzk-rQ.review_text: The single greatest dining experience in the Bay Area!  The food is very delish, the service is impeccable and the ambiance is... Just go!  If you don't love Forbes Island, you are a terrible person.  Bring your sea legs! Request Casey as you server.

yydItqMPiDX4EOfvaf_8Ug.review_text: I'm a native Californian who has spent many, many vacations in San Francisco. A tourist I am not.   My husband, on the other hand, is from New Jersey (yeah, I know...). He is enthralled with California. He has been here over a decade and has never seen the City by the Bay. So I surprised him!  We were there on Memorial Day weekend, with the celebration for the Golden Gate's 75th. We went that Sunday night.   We started to stress out a bit on the boat ride over because there was some really obnoxious kids there, but they went to a room for a private party, while we were taken downstairs.   Outstanding atmosphere? Damn straight! Excellent service? Couldn't be better. LOVED our waiter..cracked us up and served us perfectly. Wine? PHENOMENAL.   The food. Oh, the food. My husband and I actually stopped talking because the food was so flipping good. The potatoes really stick out in my mind. I remember being sad with every bite because there was a little less food for me to eat.   We then got another glass of wine and went up to the top of the light house. So, so beautiful!! I little rocky because the whole thing is floating on water, so we came right down. We watched the fireworks from the deck.   Romantic, yummy, fun...I simply could not ask for a better experience. Thank you Mr. Forbes!!

BbAyOwFx27Zhf7hxovHr7g.review_text: Who knew SF had this little nugget hiding on a man made island? Forbes Island is a very special hidden gem; perfect for a fun, romantic dinner, and even better if you're trying to "wow" some relatives with the amazingness of San Francisco.  The food is not amazing by any means, but the experience itself is top notch.  I recommend the steak, not wearing heels, and a big winter jacket on a cold night.

HgiZcV2NFasACi3_QYJezQ.review_text: I'm writing this review off of memory - a long time ago.   Taking a boat to a small island (its really just a barge) is a novel idea. It's fun to take dates/travelers here.   Unfortunately, that's the only thing I remember about the place. The steak I had was good, but nothing that made me want to go back, especially for the price tag.   Make sure to bring a jacket and a plastic bag! The trip back to land can be pretty cold at night. It can also be rocky, which is not good if you had one too many.   I'll come back again and update this someday. It deserves a second chance.

287YDYKELEL71qbCSU-z-Q.review_text: Cheesy but romantic. Liked the idea of taking the boat out to the restaurant and I think the captain was the actual owner of the place. Liked the pictures and the ambiance. Awesome views from the lighthouse over looking the bay especially at night. Food was decent, had the fish. Novel idea.

oK6CYaz8QaplYBT8IK6E-g.review_text: The food is great, but not amazing.  Go for the fun.  Our waiter was also great, very attentive and friendly.  It was a little hot in there for a few minutes but it cooled off quickly as soon as someone noticed.   That is all i can complain about.  uh, that and the annoying locals that insisted on announcing to everyone that they were, in fact, locals and they were definitely not tourists, but that has nothing to do with the restaurant.  I must say that i myself felt a little embarrassed about doing something so co touristy, but it was worth it.

bvGrZggjxWlmNgG8OrQMaA.review_text: We had a really unique experience at Forbes Island. The food was very good, the service was great and a good time was enjoyed by our entire party.  There is better food in SF, of course, but what we had was all very good. We tried most things on the menu and there is nothing not to recommend.  It is a fun place to be taken as a whole for the entire experience and not just the parts. This is a great case of the whole being greater than the sum of it's parts.  Com with a good attitude and have fun.

SzHxKwkXoepCoHka9GhUOw.review_text: Most romantic and amazing dinner experience at the bay! Absolutely loved everything about this place. You should set a reservation because the restaurant gets packed quick and is quite small. (We had a reservation and still had to wait about 30 minutes- but that didn't matter because there's so much to see on the island that keeps you occupied.) A cute little taxi takes you over to the island where you can begin drinking wine or go up the lighthouse...amazing views. The actual restaurant is downstairs, underwater! You can definitely feel the waves pass by when you're down there (there were times I felt nauseous) but still totally worth it. So cute downstairs...candlelit, a little fireplace, & roses on the tables. Great service and yummy food!

ofyyXfuPd1urrJ3GRyoBEw.review_text: This restaurant isn't on an island, it's a barge.  No views as you're dining below deck, with all the rocking motions of being in the hull of a boat.  I never thought I could get sea sick at dinner - but I did!  Not an enjoyable experience.  Food was fine, service fine, overall experience was disappointing.

sDW3aJTWPzfKS_dqZgyyvw.review_text: The worst stinkin tourist trap in town.  Going out to the fake island is like leaving reality behind and entering the lair of a dranged midget.  A deranged midget who wants to screw you of every penny by charging you a kings ransom for tiny portions of horrid food.    Rather than wasting a small fortune here, give $100 to someone living on the street.  You'll feel much better about yourself.

YfjStydK3aDvG-xAy3tVvg.review_text: I would not recommend this restaurant.  The actual restaurant is cramped, dark, and a bit creepy.  You definitely feel the sway of the water, and the windows are so mucked up with algae there is no way to see anything in the water.  Plus, the water is a brownish murky color, so even if you could see through the windows, which you can't, you probably wouldn't see anything anyway.   The food is not very good.  Our mashed potatoes tasted like they were from a powdered mix, and the entrees were very average.   The service was quite good, as both the server and the busboy/runner were attentive and nice.   Climbing up to the lighthouse after dinner was fun, but we were so ready to leave that we didn't stick around to enjoy the view.

zaojrY1aTjOE0-VCsMOLIQ.review_text: This place was a delightful surprise! Food was excellent, great bar, nice ownership and warm, romantic ambience.

NmeG_YU9ADcu9dTH3btf3g.review_text: The staff at Forbes Island (especially Casey) helped me pull off an absolutely fantastic surprise birthday party for my wife.  We reserved the top side rooms and had a wonderful time.  The food was great and the staff really went out of their way to make it special for our party and my wife.  The place is a gem in San Francisco.

NRrNQ5xHn_7Fu4ctlpKLbQ.review_text: Do come here, its a lot of fun. Its a little like a Disneyland ride for adults. The food isn't great but the ambiance is something special and original. The service is great and find a moment to walk up to the top of the light house to take a look around.   This is a floating island so if you get seasick be warned it never stops rocking.   Dinner for two with a glass of red is about $100. This is a great date location for locals hidden right in plain sight in tourist central.

1dhMYD2pJ19vPvADcpJe7A.review_text: Something truly spectacular about this place. Could it be the boat to this unique restaurant, or maybe the astonishing views from the lighthouse, or better yet personalised service coupled with great food and just simply put awesome cocktails. This is truly a unique dining experience, will definitely return again very soon.

WbrVOiwanCB5QWP_3W16Lw.review_text: The service was good, but the food was too salty and mediocre at best. Also, the plates and silverware were dirty and there were bugs flying around in the dining area. The restaurant is an overpriced touristy gimmick, not worth it.

aNExhM1VYsCJt82kOm61fw.review_text: Came here for my birthday dinner. A lovely experience. Its basically a restaurant located on a island by pier 39. The owner once lived on it for 23 years by Sausalito and then decided to partner up and turned it into a restaurant and redid his home to a small private tropical island with palm trees, waterfalls and a lighthouse!   The island was literally a floating land, therefore if you're easily sick sea try to find ways to ease it or it's a pass. To get to the island there's a private own boat that's driven by the owner himself! Dress warm if you're there on a cold night because it's interesting experience to walk around the island and up in the lighthouse too..but don't go up there drunk! It's a heck of a flight if stairs I'd youre out of shape and not able to step foot properly.   They have delicious drink menu, ambiance was interesting, majority of the walls are covered in mirrors to give you the illusion of a larger setting. Very romantic setup.   For dinner, we had the seafood chowder good for two so ask the wait staff to split, also had the brusetta (tomatoes, avocado with maybe some sort of spreading too) still delicious for both starters. I had the lamb shank, delicious as well but definitely get it made medium rare to rare...if you're a person that likes sashimi...it'll be close to it but in lamb. Didn't had dessert, portions were large enough.   A good one time experiences for special occasion or sonething new..I wouldn't try it again because I just found out I'm easily sea sick! =(

krR6HQU1NQflfQHvyhKLpA.review_text: I went to Forbes Island for my birthday during Dine About Town.  It was such a fun little adventure. :-)  First, we walked to the dock and called for the pontoon boat.  We took a very short ride to the "island."  Some of my friends had already arrived and waved at us from the top of the lighthouse.  Pretty cool!     We were seated at a nice big table near a fireplace and a few port holes (saw some fish swim by).  Adding to the novelty of eating on an "island," the chandelier swayed above our heads during the whole meal (my friend took a dramamine).  To top it off, the food was actually VERY VERY good!  We all left with smiles on our faces.  PS- The ladies room is also a unique place.  Worth a visit!

6Uin4a2NLAvGbIRr9LvHkg.review_text: Another Dine about Town "experience".  That's what it's for right?  Trying places that might not normally be on your list of restaurant to try but if it's cheap and sounds like fun, what the hell, I'll try it!    So here's the experience....two minute ferry to a man made island.  Forbes, the man himself, said he "drove" the island all the way from Sausalito and will maybe move it to Maui soon.  Cool.  Got seated at the bottom level.  Way too much for my friends that are prone to sea sickness.  Off to the top we go!  Much better!  I'm on an island, I should have fish.  Got salmon, be careful what you wish for!  Too fishy.  Dessert was good.  Well, it's chocolate cake, you usually can't go wrong with that.  Bill comes.  WTF?!  Fee for the ferry?!  Am I suppose to swim here?  Whatever!  There's a lighthouse.  Gotta do the lighthouse.  Beautiful view of the city.  Hopped back on the ferry to go home ( i did pay for it already and I wasn't about to swim).  The experience was good.

XP-XemWwq4Rmivgb9HKkFw.review_text: We went 1/25 right in the middle of a big storm.  We weren't sure if the others were going to show up since it rained nonstop that Friday.    We were a party of 6  braving the weather.  We made it on the ferry just as it was leaving manned by Mr. Forbes.   He offered to take us up to the lighthouse, but it was so rainy people just dashed in for cover.     The six of us were seated in the Blue room which only fit another table of 5.   The restaurant really is not very large at all.   Unfortunately the waters were really choppy that night and a couple of people in our party got really seasick.  One of them even stood at the top of the stairs for 40 minutes hoping her stomach would stop rolling before requesting to leave.   Dinner was not eventful.  We had the choice of a skirt steak, chicken or salmon.  The main entrees ranged from $28-$39.  Thanks to Dine About Town, our 3 course meal with tax and tip came to $41.  The food was good but was not so special and worth the cost.  The apple tart was good and so was the mousse cake.   Food was 2 stars and an extra star was for the island.    Half of our party left with their desserts to go, so seasick they felt.   The rest of us finished up and waited for the ferry to take us back to the pier.  While we waited, we explored the lighthouse which was fun.  The spiral staircase led up to the top where you could brave the winds and walk out to the balcony.    This is one place that just needs to be experienced once.  It would be fun if you can go there for appetizers and drinks on a good sunny day.  But definitely not worth the cost for dinner.    P.S.  I did like the ladies bathroom which was in the captain's bedroom all done up in red velvets with a nice warm fireplace.    that was fun.

qS97UOi5Uc0h6xZe9hYKaw.review_text: 5 stars!! Man some of the reviewers here are deprived.  The food here is really overpriced.  You have to take a 30 sec trip on a ferry boat to get to this place. This is gimmicky esp when the restaurant is actually attached to the PIER!!!  (Note to self: never dine and dash here). Pros: Food here is good but definitely nothing special.  The bar downstairs feel real cozy.  Service is nice.  The make shift light house is be somewhat romantic I guess. Good place to bring your girl friend when flowers and "I'm sorry it'll never happen again" line just won't do.  Cons: Expensive. Gimmicky. Douche bag people that give this place 5 stars

YcyenFLApHiih59KNi8aBg.review_text: The idea of this place was completely appealing -- taking a ferry to a floating restaurant that a man (Mr Forbes) made out of his home in Sausalito & brought over to SF.  The ferry ride was an easy 1-2 minutes away, and the island itself was pretty incredible. There were private dining rooms on the deck & the main dining area was downstairs, underneath the water.  It's really dark & there's only a few portholes where you can supposedly see sea creatures float about, but those spots were taken. Our table instead was at the farthest corner of the downstairs dining RIGHT next to the door leading to the kitchen & to the girl's restroom.  DO NOT GO IF YOU GET SEA-SICK EASILY.  I thought I'd be fine since I've gone boating many a time but the island is incredibly rocky!! I couldn't even sit & wait around for my meal because I was that nauseous. I kept walking around in hopes it would ease my nausea but it just got worse. When the meal came, I only had about a bite of it & had to leave the island ASAP.  I probably wouldn't try this place again.  I only gave it two stars because I really liked how the place looked. Otherwise, it would just be a one star.

3_ZXnwgmEMJx2ZRwp_nl6w.review_text: My husband and I wanted to give this place a try because of the 4 stars rating from Yelp, and we were disappointed. We had to go straight to the Crab House for more food after eating here.     We both weren't aware that we could get sea sick at this restaurant; after watching the chandelier sway repeatably the entire time and being super shaky while sitting at the bottom of the restaurant, we could barely eat anything. Food-wise, we ordered their steaks but they were overcooked and not as tender; yet hey charged for a 5-star restaurant price but not as high quality.   I definitely would not pay the fairly high prices for what I thought was not great enough. Services were great though and that's why I leave that two stars just for the service.

sW6RSPeyzzhOAfTQdNsi9w.review_text: My parents are eaters not diners; though sometimes, they try to be. Years and years ago, I took them to Andalou. BIG MISTAKE. So usually I take them to steak houses; it has the nice atmosphere, and they don't need to ask what everything is.   Last time they were in town, I took them to Forbes Island with some friends. We were running late and my parents were already at Pier 39  "Wait for me outside of Hard Rock Cafe" "We're eating at Hard Rock Cafe?!" "No, just wait for me outside" "Can we just go to the restaurant?" "No...you'll never be able to find it"  We take the little cruise, captained by Forbes himself. Upon landing, we circle up the stairs to the top of the lighthouse for an amazing view. I never get tired of looking at San Francisco, except for the 16th St. Bart station.   After exploring the island (about 3 minutes) we sit down to dinner. I am still charmed by the gaslights on the table.   The food is good. Not spectacular, but not bad. About $15 more than what I would normally spend, but this is about the "experience". Mom, Dad and all my friends loved it.  I'm knocking 1 star off of a 5 star experience for the ridiculous $3 surcharge for the boat ride.

IU86PZPgTDCFwJEuAg2j7g.review_text: Pierre is probably the most entertaining bartender in the world. Nookie has probably been made right outside the women's room, and Forbes will probably give you the same answer every time you ask him if he's ever been married.

9LZOMtuz69Dww5IBCbhGQg.review_text: This was such a great experience. The food was amazing and the waiter was very attentive, even though there was several other tables to be waited on. The atmosphere is very unique (dining below the island) and very romantic. The was food was incredible and price according to quality.  Next time we visit San Fran....we will definitely dine here again!

5v6juPIOisfmogp7QSso-A.review_text: Loved it! What a fun experience. Great food. Great people. Amazing views. Highly recommended.

YF4yDHBi7j4leETGNfEFTA.review_text: Wow! What an experience! This is a great place to go for a special occasion or if you want a special night out. It starts with a very short boat ride to the island. That island is beautiful at night all lit up with lights and the lighthouse is cute. If you get there early you can wander around the fairly small island and look at the waterfalls, the scenery, the seals and the lights from the city, but I wouldn't recommend being too early because there really isn't a place to wait in the restaurant.  We got there exactly on time but our table wasn't ready yet. We waited in that "bar". The bartenders the manager and very nice. They were very apologetic for making us wait about half an hour and comped our wine corkage fee which I thought was fair. While I thought their menu was a little limiting,  the food was pretty good (I was impressed). Our favorites were that crab scallops and avocado salad, the braised short ribs, and the apple tart. Overall a very memorable experience. I thought it was a great experience for the price. I would definitely go back.

haSh72Q0MsQZUpWPeVgp0Q.review_text: We decided to come to dinner on Forbes Island while on vacation in SF. It is a really unique dining experience and we had a great time. The 3 mins. boat ride in is easy and the "captain" is a little crazy but very funny. We ordered:  -jumbo prawns -seafood chowder -rack of lamb (medium rare) -seabass -sides: haricot vert and sauteed mushrooms  All the food was delicious, I especially enjoyed the lamb. It was prepared very well. Service was excellent. It was a nice light meal before meeting friends for cocktails later in the night.  Perfect place for a unique date.

PMWNrwuvrTwb4robAfoUhw.review_text: Forbes Island is ideal for a romantic two-some or a boisterous group of friends... either way, the place is that cool with super friendly staff and a charming boat captain.  The food is good, perhaps not the best in San Francisco, but you won't be disappointed.  It's good, dependable fare (as opposed to some of the fancy places I've eaten in recently ~ no names mentioned~ where only half the dishes were worth the exorbitant prices).  More than anything, it's a 'destination'... somewhere completely different away from the madding crowd.

Uqd2zmlHlM944LJhB50NkA.review_text: I've been here on three occasions now and feel comfortable saying that this place is a gem. So much so that my sister and I hosted our mom's birthday there.   Yes, it's near the tourists, but really.... I don't understand why locals hate tourists so much. Granted, there are a lot of them in this area, but if that stops you from trying restaurants in the area, you don't deserve to be treated to this spot anyway. Stop it already with the pre-conceived notions. I digress...  The experience of dining of Forbes Island merits 5 stars all on it's own. The service is outstanding and it's completely unique. True, some people might be too queasy to dine here, but honestly, you can only feel the movement of the water if a ferry passes by (usually slows down a lot during dinner time) and if you stand very still. Only if you are VERY VERY sensitive to motion should you second guess coming here. Otherwise, moving around the island and even just sitting and talking is enough to make you dismiss slight movement you might feel.   Pre-conceived ideas about food in a touristy area are generally merited, but the food here is good. The lamb I had on my last visit was excellent in flavor, presentation, and cooked to a perfect medium. The pricing is appropriate for the quality/quantity and the cocktails are well done. I highly recommend the Valrhona chocolate cake for dessert. It is rich, but not overly sweet and I assure you.... you will want to sit and savor it while you look at the view for a long while... if you can keep yourself from devouring it within the first minute of service, that is.  I always worry that receiving good reviews will ruin my favorite spots, but hopefully, Forbes will keep things even-keel for many years to come.

fGxFCmjNQju3EfbvPu4S0Q.review_text: We went to Pier 39 via Ferry from Alameda on a whim for Independence Day. We arrived mid afternoon with no plans or Reservations. Went to Beer 39 and had a couple of brews while searching for a place to have dinner on the I pad. Most places were booked. We decided to walk around and check it out when I remembered a place Called Forbes Island that we had dinner at last summer. You have to take Mr.  Forbes water taxi to the restaurant because it is on Forbes Island. The Island is man maid (by Forbes) and it has waterfalls, a light house, beaches ect...  You can dine down stairs which is underwater with port holes and a cool bar or upstairs in a tiki themed room with views of Alcatraz and Angle Island  So, we saw the water taxi at the dock with Forbes standing there. I called down to him asking if he had any reservations. He motioned down to the dock and told us they had a fixed menu that night and were full but he would see what he could do. Next thing you know we are on our way to the island. We chose upstairs in the Tiki Room. What views!  We chose from the five course fixed menu. Great choices. I had the rack of Lamb as my entree'. All of the courses were top notch. Had a great bottle of Chardonnay with dinner. Arial was our server. Very rarely can I say I have received five star service. We did! She was amazing. She told us to stay until 9:30 when the fireworks display started. Never pushed us for time.  The fireworks display was awesome. The barges that they dispersed the fireworks from were maybe 500 feet away, right over our heads! Arial served us Porto and coffee on the deck while we watched the show.  What a perfect way to spend Independence Day. I highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion. Great job Forbes!!

F3BPJS3f3R3IdwVR-R-u6w.review_text: A San Fran secret for sure! A good romantic date idea (make sure she brings a jacket) and makes for a great post date story to tell at the very least. Forbes Island is actually a vessel made to look like an actual Island docked in the bay at peir 38. You are taken to the restaurant via a small boat that picks you up and drops you off, the food is good, the atmosphere is really romantic with a fireplace, interesting historical art and a rich dark wood feel...I don't think it's for everyone per some of the reviews I have read but again makes for a great date story and if your with someone who appreciates a softer romantic side, then I would definitely recommend.

KUJLCLXTVQZDXUffEMAcYg.review_text: I looooove this place! The food was great, the ambience, the service were exceptional! The place itself is like a treasure island and we really had a fun time exploring the "island".

3guBkOE9Gw73rJ4eS_u6og.review_text: My small company wanted to get together for a night out with only a couple days notice. Casey, the coordinator we worked with at Forbes Island, was extremely accommodating. He helped us with menu options and dining room availability throughout the two days leading up to the event.  The restaurant is gorgeous and very well kept. Our server was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  Each team member is excited for their next trip to the island - it made for a lasting impression!

NEOSYsubf7SVeVm8RytxYA.review_text: Cutest unique spot located near Pier 39.  In my youth, I would see the seals and just assumed that the mini lighthouse behind them was just for show.  Little did I know that this was a mini tropical paradise restaurant!  You have to take a little both shuttle to get there.  A unique little experience for those visiting Pier 39.  Great spot for a romantic date.

mDOoUdBW45N-tyFV0z1yZg.review_text: The atmosphere was pleasant and unusual; the view from the lighthouse was phenomenal.  The food and service were good.  Both of us had steak, good cuts of meat prepared as we had ordered them (which, we all know, is not the case in every restaurant).  The appetizer and sides were good.  The man who ferried us back and forth from land was a gruff, unfriendly old guy; our interaction with him tainted the whole experience.

sPymS_ZrwE7g7BNPs6Q-Cg.review_text: I've been here a few times and Forbes Island will always be at the top of my list for unique places in San Fransisco to eat that most people have never heard of or seen...even people who live in SF don't know about it.  You get to take a little boat ride to the island captained by Mr. Forbes himself. He's a really interesting guy who takes to return customers very well and always greets new diners with the same respect.   There are quite a few reviews about the rooms, lighthouse, and cool venue this is so I won't touch on those...not much I can add.  I love the feel of this place the best...especially if you get to eat downstairs (underwater) near the bar. It's quiet, intimate, relaxing, and the service staff does everything to make sure that feel isn't ruined.   Service is friendly, perfectly timed, very helpful when it comes to special requests, and really couldn't be better. I will definately consider making reservations at Forbes Island for any large formal event I may hold in the future.  A few years ago, I and my ex shard a wonderful 4th of July dinner and fireworks show on Forbes Island. This was one of the best times of my life. Couldn't have found a better place to have a unique 4th of July time.   A+ all the way. Food was incredible, dessert left me only wanting more, and everything else along the way gives this place 5 stars with no doubt. An added bonus was seeing little fish swimming by the portholes below deck...very cool.  Spend-o-meter: up there but worth every penny Value: excellent...the whole experience from boat ride, to food, to walking around the island, and up the lighthouse. Can't beat it. Will I go back: you better believe it.  This is one place you need to experience at least once when you're in SF. It's definitely one of SF's best kept secrets out there for everyone to see at anytime.

vp3ZJlr4YT4wfRSUPtv7UA.review_text: I would say the experience and the ambiance is definitely unique. Everything from the private shuttle boat (the only way to get there is by boat) to the view atop of the Lighthouse of the City & Bay at sunset. The food started out good with appetizers;Avocado Dungenous Crab & Bay Shrimp, Sauteed Mushrooom Ragout. Then the Entrees came with Sea Bas which was delicious, and the Fillet of Sole which was ok, kinda dry and overcooked to my taste.  Dessert was Pomegranate Sorbet with Vanilla Gelato with fresh strawberries & mint leaves served in a Martini glass which was yummy. We also went into the bedroom downstairs on the other side, it was really dark there. I would say this is certainly a place to experience in San Francisco and something to remember.

WYY_lBnsLb-JzY5xf6DJOw.review_text: This place is a wonderful and romantic restaurant.  Obviously, not for people with motion sickness/sea sickness. It's a floating island, it's going to rock a little. Duh.  Anyway, fun and short boat ride to the island with an entertaining pilot, seated immediately, beautiful accommodations. Small tables with roses and candles, nautical artwork on the walls, attentive staff, and DELICIOUS food. I had the Caesar salad as an appetizer, an excellent choice. Only one vegetarian option (mushroom risotto), which is typical of fancy restaurants, but it was so good and I don't even like mushrooms. Haha  Plus, we had asked for something to toast with (it was my and my bf's anniversary), and then later, when the waitress brought our dessert, they had decorated the plate around the fantastic mousse with the words "Happy Anniversary!" Very thoughtful and of course, like everything else, delicious.  The only thing that made me sad is, though it's an underwater restaurant, there are only two portholes where you can actually see the water outside, and those are usually reserved for parties and the like. You can't request to be seated by them (I tried!) and so you lose some of the magic of eating underwater without actually being able to, you know, SEE the water next to you. Oh well.  Oh, and make sure to go to the top of the lighthouse. GORGEOUS views of SF and the bay, especially after sunset. Photo opportunities galore.  I will recommend this place to everyone and will definitely return!

JvQRbZYdMGuuDqTArles2g.review_text: Eclectic and unique... a man-made, floating island.  It is definitely a fun and different place to go have dinner, but I was not wowed by the food at all.  First off, don't have the clam chowder; it may have been Campbell's.  Second, I had the salmon on a bed of cilantro rice.  It was good, but I could have done a better on my own grill with the salmon.  I was sucked in by the waitress saying they have a small kitchen and they pick a few things to do really well.  Extra points for the unique location, but your foodie dollars will go further elsewhere.

6Vsy1GPnJGiZO-1cjv8Eqw.review_text: I haven't been to Forbes since my 3++ birthday party and it was awesome then but its even more awesome now since Casey came on board.  I threw my company's Holiday Soiree here and every one loved it I was receiving text messages and emails all weekend long!

rdYds7DdlCczgctT7WzNlw.review_text: thanks to Dine about Town i finally got to try out Forbes  with my friends. I've been to the pier a kabillion times and never noticed Forbes until best of the bay or something on tv about sf featured Forbes Island.  so fun experience  #1... 3 min boat ride...everyone around us was like dang were those girls going behind that red rope...oh dang onto a boat???? (OKok maybe not like this but we did get some curious stares) #2... hilarious captain. he told us to sit on the right side, but my slow friend sat on the left and he was like it's ok it'll balance out the boat!  #3... lighthouse w/ an awesome view of the sun setting and sea lions.... one women was like "are those whales!??"  haha tourist! #4... great pre-fix meal. half of us had the salmon non cilantro/pesto rice and mix berry w/ mascarpone cheese (like a parfait)   and the other half had steak something with chocolate mousse cake (sooo rich!) #5... singing happy birthday to strangers (see this place aint high end. you can still act a fool) #6... best  bathroom i've ever been in for a restaurant. inside was like a little hut and after using it everyone was like "wow...smelled good in there!" and it was clean.  since Forbes is a man made island it like eating on boat. you can feel the subtle rocking and swaying. but you'll get use to it...just dont go on a super windy day.

IOoR8_05eltJPEvwSDCZjw.review_text: This is a unique experience that is well worth a visit.  The restaurant was an elaborate houseboat that had a lighthouse and was turned into an island restaurant. At your reservation time, you go to the dock and a boat picks you up and takes you to the restaurant. You can go up into the lighthouse before or after your meal. You will be eating inside the former houseboat where there are portholes. The women's rest room is worth a visit as it was originally the state room. The setting was worth the visit but so was the food. The meal was really outstanding. Yes, it is pricey. However, my salmon was cooked perfectly, presented nicely and the flavor was wonderful. Service was great. Although there is no children's menu, they offered pasta for them. They also have a gluten free menu upon request. For dessert, the creme brulee was excellent. It would be great for a special occasion but also just for an excellent meal. It was truly memorable."

qVgjrCh20VNSm04oCJYNUQ.review_text: This is place is a date place for events such as B-days. Something for you to talk about and how memorable it is. They say going out is half about  the atmosphere and the other half is the food, well, it was a short boat ride and was kind of cheesy. But was kind of fun. It's located in Pier 39 and a tourist attraction. You take a ferry boat to the restaurant and its a floating island. Service was good, food was good. Not 5 star gourmet but 5 star wholesome dishes.    We had the flat iron steak, good, half rack of lamb, good, generous portions, considering 29 for the steak and 35 for the lamb. Appetizers was a crab avocado salad and seafood stew. Both Good. Had the chocolate mouse to share.  I would had prefer to sit upstairs where there a view but they stuck us below because the that's where the main dining room is. Splitting everyone would a be mess I guess.  Over all good experience and good to being friends visiting. Other than that, once in a few years as a date place but not a regular eatery.

N7b4-RNm4EL-vE0DQRZDhw.review_text: My baby took me here for an amazing surprise dinner Saturday night.  It is a "floating" restaurant that you take a quick 5 min boat ride to from pier 39. The decor of the restaurant is so warm and romantic with dim lighting and a fireplace in the center.    The food was delicious.  We had a very good Hawaiian Poke for appetizer, and then short ribs and salmon for entree.  I was having a hard time deciding between the salmon or the mushroom risotto, and the waitress/chef was very accommodating in letting me substitute my side of rice with mushroom risotto!    The staff was very attentive, but not overbearing.  Our water glasses were always filled.    This is a fabulous place to go on a date, or with someone special.  Each table has a nice little gas lamp and a long stem rose.  Definitely, a perfect date spot :)

vmMAPh4F-wM2PWSAFYToHA.review_text: "How was Forbes Island?" "Interesting." "Interesting good or interesting bad?" "Both."  The Good Generally attentive service, wonderful bread, simple yet thorough menu (lamb, beef, chicken, fish.) Well prepared Halibut Cheeks cooked dore style. Taking a water taxi to the restaurant and the great view from the lighthouse as well as the deck chairs when waiting for the taxi. Talking to the French man at the bar who also answers the phones.  The Bad Slightly overdressed salad. Being seated behind a table that was extended from 4 to six making for a tight squeeze. Our waitress forgot to bring us change for a good 6-7 minutes.  The Ugly Seasickness (the majority of the restaurant is below the water line, so there are no windows unless you eat on the top deck.) A single men's restroom on top deck. The quasi-"tour" the water taxi captain gave us when we were already running late (mildly interesting but strange feeling.) Not being able to find the dock (it's under Eagle's Cafe.)

rqKILWUIT9hX5X5Uh68odA.review_text: Had dinner last night at one of the best kept secrets of the San Francisco area. This place is a man made island floating at pier 39 next to the area where all the seals rest. It is only reachable by boat at Pier 39 and the boat captains are very knowledgeable of the history of the island. There is a real light house erected on the island with 55 steps to the top for a nearly 360 degree view of a beautiful city for photos. What waits inside is great food with great service. Forbes offers a really nice selection of salads, appetizers, entrees and desserts at very reasonable prices. It is worth the experience and the food and service are really great. Next time you are in San Francisco, CA you need to make this a destination experience and dine below sea level for once in your life.

fqP1LZPK-L9QDPxFoSlDOg.review_text: THE CUTEST ONCE IN A LIFE TIME EXPERIENCE!  It was a cold sf evening.. LIKE ALWAYS! We dialed in and waited for the boat to come pick us on. On the boat Mr. Kiddoo was asking how we all found out about this place.. and thats all thanks to YELP! When we arrived on the island, I felt like a queen entering her own private dinner.  I was with 5 others, including my boyfriend. It was my friends 3 year anniversary but she didn't want any of us to miss out on this oppurtunity. When we sat down in the dining room underwater, it was ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS! Very Victorian.. Our server introduced himself and started us off with water, a bottle of champagne, and bread. We ordered:  Clam Chowder; had fish=[ I'm allergic to fish but my friends all had a nod of approval. Bell Pepper Soup; pretty delicious for bell peppers! BtjJqsMMjBSFLKu5sGN5Ng.review_text: This is a place for it ambiance. The food was all right. It was an unique experience.  You get pick up by their shuttle and the ride is about 5 minutes. This restaurant was showcased on some food TV show or traveling show. It took the owner 10 yrs to get all the licenses. We were lucky to meet the owner on Saturday coz he only operate the shuttle once a week, the shuttle is operated by employee on other days.  Upon arrival the owner will show you around the island (which takes less than 5 minutes).  The restaurant is under water and you can feel it when the wave hit hard. The decor is romantic. This is defiantly a place for occasion for me. The food was just all right for me. I had salmon and my bf had filet mignon. I regretted not to order their special dish that night coz my neighbor table ordered it and they enjoy it so much. It was halibut cheek!  The dessert was fine for me. It wasn't anything that would make you go into a diabetic coma. The portion and the sweetness were just delightful. The light house was neat and we snapped quit some good shots. The night was memorable. 5 stars for the over all experience and 5 stars for the ambiance. 3 stars for the food.

ibRTPCNETk1DIUku4Ccc8g.review_text: 1] Food: (A+) We ordered 6 types of the most flavorful appetizers( Tiger Prawns, Edamame Crostinis, Chicken Satay, Wild Mushroom Duxelle, Veggie Somosas, Veggie Platter), and each were AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS. All of my guests were ranting and raving especially about the Edamame Crostinis and Wild Mushroom Duxelle.  2] Dessert: (A+) We had the platter of chocolate mousse with pecan crust and it was beyond tasty and delightful to sweeten our palettes after dinner.  3] Drinks: (A) Ordered the open bar for Wines, Champagnes, and Beers.  4] Service: (A+) Our waitress Tricia and event planner Casey were BEYOND AMAZING. 7B-WhDB_aklGr1Y6U81qeg.review_text: Honestly, this place is downright magical. It's a perfect balance of unique and beautiful -- and the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming. You can tell they're proud of this amazing place, and they should be. With the gorgeous scenery at the top of the lighthouse and the warm vibe of the restaurant, you would probably have a great experience even if the food was just so-so. But the food is incredible, and there is an extensive wine list with many local selections.   Forbes Island provided one of the most enjoyable and romantic dining experiences I can remember, and it will be a must-visit anytime we return to San Francisco.

g34vhGaV-ixUzq0Zbt9MEQ.review_text: you know....this place is cool. it is SOOO unbelievably touristy, but it rules. my boyfriend and i went there for our 1 year anniversary. see we use to do these "touristy" things on mondays...we called them adventure mondays and we would explore all the things people do when they come to sf as a tourist.....i think we forget about why we live in this city sometimes. there is so much to do, to see. i think this is a hidden treasure. fun, adventurous, pretty good food, but the atmosphere...the best!! romantic and fun all at the same time......but please, if you get seasick....do not attempt!

Mu7fuOjMqOqYO0Lc5S60JQ.review_text: On September 10th, 2011, we recently held our wedding at Forbes Island. It went perfect. We scoped the place out months beforehand and met with Casey- the man directing much of the planning and front-facing focus of the island. He was both warm and uniquely accommodating, an excellent combination when planning a wedding. If not for Casey, Forbes himself, and the rest of their unique and personable staff, we would not have had such a beautiful wedding! It was almost unsettling how WELL everything fell together... aside from the cake, a few decorations, and deciding what to eat, the staff had everything prepared without much need for our support save the occasional decision. There was no delay in serving drinks, and food; everything was cooked perfectly with compliments all around. The island is wired for ambient music, and our choices synchronized throughout the island. We were concerned that some folks may find themselves seasick, but the island was stable, and Casey's team came prepared with ginger backups for us just in case. Having a party or a once in a lifetime celebration? Forbes Island is the perfect place, not only for it's unique and fun environment, but for top notch service, professional and personable staff, and excellent cuisine. And if you just come to dinner, you'll probably run into us as new, frequent diners. You can see some photos of the wedding at: flickr.com/photos/bradyj…

98nWp7hEx_ruWXExPCbJrQ.review_text: My daughters were turning 30, and 26, and I wanted to make a big deal out of it, and find a special place to celebrate with family.  I did a lot of research online, to find someplace different. I never knew Forbes Island was out there, but I am very happy I found it.  All the planning was done by emails, every email was promptly answered.  I thought it very unique, that the only access to the island was by a shuttle boat. Everybody enjoyed the ride. When we reached the island, we were greated by a very friendly staff. We had appetizers and drinks served in a reception room,  upon arrival, and then , when we were ready, proceeded into the "Tahiti Room" for our dinner.( I also hired Heather Rogers, a magician, to do some entertaining in the reception room. She was awesome,)There were no problems, complaints, delays, or dissapointments from anybody. The food was delicious, served on time, and as requested. I had a preplanned menu consisting of mshroom risotto, rack of lamb, filet mignon, and trout. The food was outstanding!!!. Afterwards, we received a cake, which was just as delicious.  Since I had prearranged everything, during the entire event, I was not disturbed by the staff with having to make decisions, which made it very enjoyable for me. My group of 23 left very happy.

sjuom2W3qzoe3LD1KXsf6w.review_text:
i can't believe this place only has 3.5 stars!  i had a great experience here and i have to disagree with it being touristy.  most locals don't know about this place, let alone tourists!
  so about my experience...after taking the tiki boat from the H dock near pier 39 to the island, we started off by climbing up the lighthouse and checking out the view of the bay, which, of course, was amazing.  from there, we made our way downstairs to the dining area which is decorated with everything nautical.  we were seated at a cozy table for two by the fireplace, and as we were reading our menus, i noticed that you can actually feel the island bobbing up and down in the water.  for dinner, we had the pork chop and the lamb with a side of the broccoli and shiitake puff and a bottle of the elizabeth spencer pinot noir.  i enjoyed the food (especially the puff), but what really stands out about this place is the ambiance.
  all in all,  a great little place that is perfect for a date.  my only complaints are that they charge you for the boat ride and there is no cheese plate on the dessert menu.

NP0WS2gvmpThtY5h7PrMeQ.review_text: I really wanted to enjoy my experience at Forbes Island ... really I did.  However, what I walked away from was feeling sea sick and a doggie bag of bad EXPENSIVE wedding type food.  Maybe it was my own fault that I did not realize that I could get sea sick at this restaurant, but after watching the chandelier sway back and forth for 30 minutes and watching my husband pick at mediocre$16 tuna tartar, I could barely stomach waiting for my entree. My short ribs arrived paired with mashed potatoes (looked like it was squeeze out of a plastic bag) and spinach.  I took 2 bites and can only describe it as really really bad wedding banquet type food.  The most enjoyable part was the 3 minute boat ride to the island and back and the waitress was really quick about getting us our check because I needed to get off the island ... fast!  As San Franciscans, we realize that this is likely an attraction for tourists and I hesitate to call it a "tourist trap", but I assure you, there are plenty of other restaurants at Pier 39 that would provide a better dining experience.

AEZwukcih8z5CFk-6_ZP9Q.review_text: Absolutely wonderful, so romantic my boyfriend wanted to eat here while visiting. We did the online reservation and got there 30 mins early, and caught the little ferry that is just to the left of pier 39 (where people watch the seals!). The little boat ride over was so nice, the man was telling us all about Forbes Island and was very sweet.   They let us pick where ever we wanted to sit even though we were early and our meal was delicious! I got the short ribs my boyfriend got the Canadian Salmon. We had a few drinks which were very strong. It isn't themed in a kitchie way and had a nice warm fireplace and very lovely vibe.  Can't say enough awesome things. You are free to explore the small movable little island and get a kiss at the top of the lighthouse. I'm a local and this is definitely a great meal and awesome experience even if you've lived here your whole life. I have eaten at some delicious places and this is right up there. The only reason it isn't 5 stars is we had eaten at Morimoto's earlier in the week and that omakase blew me away. Forbes is not that good but it is very delicious (not just for being on a floating island) but just delicious overall.   THE RUN DOWN: Large portions, great bread and butter, main dishes and strong drinks in a romantic and warm atmosphere.

acjoaJ2vDWb0AacFKzNLcA.review_text: Take your out-of-town guests here if they like something kind of kitsch. The food is fine, but the setting is the reason you go here. It's floating! You take a little boat to get to it! It's weird and awesome and kind of a fun thing to go to.

yM6heLD8YJjMaA1uEL9-kw.review_text: Rent this place out!  My wife and I were invited to Forbes Island by a close friend who rented it out for his 40th birthday / 10th wedding anniversary.   The uniqueness of this place started right on the dock.  We were greeted by the (former?) owner of the island on the dock.  From that moment on, we were meeting new people and enjoying the energy that comes from experiencing new things.    The island itself is something to behold.  The light house is magnificent.  I have been here for 16 years and have never looked back towards SF from that vantage point.  Beware, it was windy.  I can imagine it is windy out there often.  This did not put a damper on things at all.  The topside bar / lounge area was open and sheltered.   Having the run of the place gave it a great feeling of exploration.    Once we sat down for the meal, we were equally pleased.  The Lamb was the best choice for the night.  Top notch.   One thing to check out is the woman's bathroom.... even if you are not a woman.   Classic captain's quarters.

mKfW-Cv7JCsH4sWUpQ8sYA.review_text: I think that I am a little biased because my husband proposed here but I love this place.  They have a lovely and varying menu and the bar is well stocked.  I love taking the little ferry boat out to the island and checking out the light house and watching the sealions.  The island does move a bit so this place isn't for those of you who are really prone to motion sickness.  But it's too cute to pass up if you are in SF and want great high end food.  We usually order steak here.    Last time we got to ride back to the "mainland" with the chef (guess we were the last to leave) and she asked us how we liked everything and how she could improve and really seemed to care.  I have been here 3 times and really feel there isn't much better in San Francisco

G91MV2wxDozdDQ4tTMp6OQ.review_text: Different. I expected a little more. The atmosphere made me feel as if i were in a dungeon. To those who are claustrophobic, this is not an ideal place to dine.

5bgsQymr8HDT3tyC1N3Uhg.review_text: The BF and I came here for our birthday weekend and had a wonderful time. i'd always seen this while visiting the wharf but never thought about dining here. so this time around, we decided that since we were celebrating a special occasion, we'd give it a try.  reservations were made well in advance since it was a Saturday night. when we arrived, we didn't know where to go so we had to call the restaurant to ask for guidance. we finally found the gate that leads us to the boat which would take us to the restaurant. this was October so it was slightly chilly out, even though it was a short ride, the boat does provide blankets to cover you up if you happen to get too cold. the driver of the boat was super nice and chatted with us for a bit while we waited for more people to show up.  once we got to the restaurant, we were taken down the the bottom and were seated next to the fireplace which was really nice. because it was night time, we couldnt see much out the port holes anyway.  the restaurant is super small and intimate. but we didnt feel cramped at all.  my BF ordered the Lamp Lollipops while I had the French Country Style Chicken with potatoes and vegetables (i asked not to have the white wine fraiche sauce). we also had a bottle of red wine with our meal. both of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals! it was a fun and romantic dining experience. my BF even got a birthday dessert!   after our meal, we took our last bit of wine in our glass and walked up to the light house to enjoy the night view. timing was perfect because the pier had a fireworks show right around that time so we sat atop the light house and watched the fireworks to end our birthday dinner celebration!   i'd definitely recommend this place for any special occasion, especially with a significant other.   p.s. if you want to check into this place, do it before waling down to the dining room there's no signal down there LOL

9kN90MlD0nOTsw2La546mw.review_text: A very unique dining experience... Even though it's located at the most popular tourist attraction, it's definitely not one of the typical tourist traps. In fact, most of the people we've met at the restaurant were from San Francisco or Bay Area... locals, just like us. The boat ride to the Forbes Island makes the experience a little bit more special, but you don't feel like you are stuck there with no way out. The boat goes back and forth all night long. The food was excellent! We had tuna tar-tar and potato-leek soup to start with, and the sea bass special & steak for the main courses. They also have a great dessert selection... very yummy.  In addition to the food and service the restaurant offers spectacular views of the city. If you go up to the light house (pretty steep stairs) do not forget your camera, you will be pleasantly surprised. The sea lions are right next to the island, so you can observe their funny behaviors from the deck. But when you are in the dining area (they have several of them) all the noise from the outside is gone, so you can really enjoy the food and the atmosphere.

sPbvkEuuaafXFLEwYl1Ikw.review_text: Wacky but real, kitschy but elegant, there's more and less to Forbes Island than meets the eye. Some people will love it, some won't. Read on to see were you'll fit. Your evening begins at a private dock right next to pier 39. There a colossal, suave and friendly 70 year old eccentric millionaire named Forbes Thor Kiddoo (I couldn't make that up) will ferry to his island in a large tiki-style  pontoon boat.   Forbes Island is man-made and floats in San Francisco bay. It features a 40 foot tall light house offering great views of the bay and the city, a beach (covered with stepping stones for the benefit of women in high heels), three large dinning rooms, at least seven large palm trees and a white picket fence. The main dinning room is concealed in the bowels of the island, under the beach and lighthouse. Its beautiful, done in Tudor wooden paneling, lit by a chandelier, warmed by a real fireplace and filled with tastefully selected nautical antiques. Portholes give you an underwater view of the bay, and a handy fish guide helps identify species outside the window. The island is home to many amusements besides the basic French menu. The lighthouse provides spectacular views of the city and the bay, the island is fun to walk around and explore, a presentation on construction of the island is available and many of the dinners interacted with one another. Ask for a tour of the wine cellar, and I hear the woman's bathroom is definitely worth checking out. The wine cellar also has a cozy table for two you could try and request. The food (menu here menupix.com/sf/menu.php?…) is good but not great nor, at $75-100 a person, cheap. The boat ride to the island is cool, and so is the underwater dinning room. But the trip is maybe four minutes long (the island is only a 100 yards out, if that), and careful observers will note the dinning room is only partially under the water line (20,000 millimeters under sea in the words of one wag). All I actually saw through the porthole was some algae, but the rocking of the room might be enough to induce sea sickness in the ultra sensitive. Should you go? Depends on what you are looking for. Here are my suggestions for some specific people: Betty Boop... Yes!!!! Overdone and anachronistic but still cool and sexy, unique but comfortable in her own skin, Betty would be right at home anywhere on the island, especially on Forbe's arm. SpongeBob and Sandy: Another perfect fit. I mean come on-- its a romantic island! They'd have a blast, and make lots of new friends. Ditto for Fred and Daphne, with or without Scooby. Tony & Carmella Soprano for a 'make-up dinner' after one of Tony's 19 year old blond extracurricular activities has come to Carmella's attention... No. Too distracting, too foreign an environment, they'd go old-school Italian. Tony & Carmella & the kids when they want to bond: AJ would bitch about Forbes Island being too touristy (its not...but AJ's too stupid and superficial to see beyond the Fisherman's Wharf location), Meadow and Carmella would get into it, have fun, maybe even become friends with the girls at the next table. Tony would think it was an OK idea but would rather be at the Bing or having more extracurricular activities. Dr. Evil with Mr. Bigglesworth and Mini-Me. Absolutely.  They could use the light house as a viewing platform to plot their domination of the city, Mr. Biglesworth would enjoy the fresh seafood, and the island has an airlock (apparently added to allow easy collection of abalone) built into its underside that could be used as an emergency escape hatch. Anyone looking to throw a party, wedding, or corporate event to be remember: Yes. Forbes Island would make any kind of gathering fun and unforgettable. Added bonus... its an island so your guests couldn't sneak away.

t6lMGRkL8XHMi5wcVVQ0yg.review_text: We hosted a party at Forbes Island for our daughter's graduation from vet school. My first contact with Casey, the event planner,was informative and helpful. All and all a great celebration at a very fun and unique restaurant.

9RcKSpPAB5yztbMQq8hVWQ.review_text: OMG how is this place not more known! You can only find this restaurant by first making a reservation and then by private boat.. so there is no stumbling upon it. zl2sY81-P7k541pWvFAZRQ.review_text: After reading the Yelp reviews, I was not expecting much.  But this place is loads of fun, and the food is good too!  Forbes is a bit odd, but what do you expect?  He built a floating island!  I think the place is amazing.  Yes, it is very kitschy, but it is unpretentious kitsch.  If you like Las Vegas, you should dig this place.  The main dining room is fabulous.  It has great, cozy ambience and loads of nautical decor.  Even the ladies room is amazing!  I was surprised how good the food was.  I ordered the salmon and it was delicious.  I took my husband for his 50th birthday, and I have to say, it is a great place for such an event.  The wine list is a bit paltry, and corkage is expensive ($25) but other than that, I would recommend!

iBkYjyuOWK0dpkq1cxDOkw.review_text: First and foremost the website should post a warning that this is much like being on a boat, it is a boat! If I went back, I would take Dramamine.
